homeData.information: I like solving problems and living moments that will become stories
values: There's a lot of people who know a lot more than I do - I want to learn from them
Make friends from all walks of life - they'll just help you try new things
If I think its going to work I will full send it
Show up and be grateful - the things you want will come your way
Be unapologetically yourself and you'll attract the people you want to spend time with

experiences.title: Inika
experiences.description:
Joined my friends out of college to build an AI-native ecommerce platform. We scaled from zero to ~20 signed customers after raising pre-seed funding.

Built the core storefront experience that 18 live stores use - everything from shopping carts and checkout to real-time inventory. Also shipped conversational commerce where customers can chat with AI to find products, which boosted click-through rates and handled almost half of customer support tickets.

Created analytics dashboards where you can literally talk to your data and get instant charts, plus unified ad management across Google, Meta, TikTok that uses AI to auto-generate campaigns.

experiences.title: Stealth Startup
experiences.description:
Worked at a stealth startup building AI for customer service ticket resolution across Southeast Asia. Built pipelines to wrangle messy data from 40+ locations into something actually useful for training AI models.

Also created a Telegram bot for customer service that was smart enough to figure out which team should handle each ticket - cut response times by 1-2 days which was huge for customer satisfaction.

experiences.title: Linkt AI
experiences.description:
Second engineering hire at a startup building computer vision for moving companies. Built a web app where movers could point their phone at stuff and it would automatically track inventory in real-time.

The cool part was implementing Kalman filtering to make the object detection super smooth across multiple video frames.

experiences.title: Ernst & Young
experiences.description:
Technology consulting intern where I got to work on some pretty cool stuff. Built a tool that could automatically suggest project teams by reading through tons of organizational data - like having an AI recruiter that knew everyone's skills.

Won the EY GenAI Foundry Hackathon with that project! Also worked with the Special Olympics building secure data systems and custom validation features that kept 100+ users' data safe while making everything way more efficient.

experiences.title: Georgia Tech Junior Design
experiences.description:
Worked on the Hand Heart and Soul Project with a local nonprofit to build them a better way to manage their events and data. Created a React Native app that cut their workflow time in half by making it super easy to input and visualize event information.

Built an internal dashboard where different teams could actually talk to each other and track progress - sounds basic but made a huge difference for their team coordination. Also set up automatic CSV exports so they could easily share impact data with donors.

experiences.title: Keysight Technologies
experiences.description:
Product management intern working on cybersecurity training materials for the sales team. Built a documentation website from scratch to cover product features that nobody had bothered to document before.

Also created training videos for customer onboarding that walked through network security assessments in AWS sandbox environments - basically made it way easier for new customers to actually understand what they were buying and for sales staff to pitch the product.
